thoughts.text: I need to write a Python script that reads a CSV file and performs some basic data analysis using pandas.
thoughts.reasoning: Writing a Python script that reads a CSV file and performs some basic data analysis using pandas will allow me to test that the library was installed correctly and begin using it in my work. This will help me save time and ensure that I am working with the correct version of the library.
thoughts.plan:
- Write a Python script that reads a CSV file and performs some basic data analysis using pandas
- Save the script with a .py extension
- Use the `execute_python_file` command to run the script
- Verify that the script ran correctly and produced the expected output
thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure that I am using the correct version of Python and that I am not introducing any security vulnerabilities.
thoughts.speak: I need to write a Python script that reads a CSV file and performs some basic data analysis using pandas.

args.text:
# Import the pandas library
import pandas as pd

# Read the CSV file into a pandas dataframe
data = pd.read_csv('data.csv')

# Print the first 5 rows of the dataframe
print(data.head())

# Print the shape of the dataframe
print(data.shape)

# Print the mean of the 'age' column
print(data['age'].mean())
